meta.content: Dalton Public Schools - City District in Dalton, Georgia. Creating the Dalton Difference for every student, every day.

section.class: fsElement fsNews fsSlideshow fsItemCount_9 fsSlideshowHorizontal fsThumbnailOriginal fsThumbnailLarge

div.a: All News
Dalton Names Principal for New Grade 10-12 High School

img.alt: Dalton Names Principal for New Grade 10-12 High School

div.p: Dr. Matthew Mederios has been approved by the Dalton Board of Education as the principal for the new grades 10-12 high school that is scheduled to open in August 2021. Mederios will join the district on July 1, 2020.

article.a: Read more about Dalton Names Principal for New Grade 10-12 High School

div.a: Dalton Public Schools Premieres New District Video

img.alt: Dalton Public Schools Premieres New District Video

div.p: Dalton Public Schools premiered a new district video on Thursday, April 16. This video highlights each school in the district and the many exciting programs and opportunities available to students.

article.a: Read more about Dalton Public Schools Premieres New District Video

div.a: Big Red Reads Summer Reading Program Begins Early

img.alt: Big Red Reads Summer Reading Program Begins Early

div.p: As the announcement was made that students would be at home doing digital learning for the remainder of the year, Alice Ensley, an instructional literacy coach and creator of Big Red Reads, began the program early.

article.a: Read more about Big Red Reads Summer Reading Program Begins Early

div.a: Dalton Names Two New Administrators

div.p: Dalton Public Schools has named Pamela Wiles as the director of special education for the district. They also named Missie McKinney as the principal for the new grades 8-9 school opening in August 2021. Wiles comes to Dalton from Hot Springs, Arkansas while McKinney is a long-time Dalton Public Schools employee currently serving as an assistant principal at Dalton High School.

article.a: Read more about Dalton Names Two New Administrators

div.a: Dalton Middle School Teacher Connects with Students in Live Talk Show

img.alt: Dalton Middle School Teacher Connects with Students in Live Talk Show

div.p: As Dalton Public Schools entered into a long-term closure, teachers and students had to find new ways to connect. Many turned to Zoom conferences, phone calls and videos. Courtenay Cholovich, Dalton Middle School drama teacher, had a different idea. She launched a weekly live talk show targeted towards Dalton Middle School students.

article.a: Read more about Dalton Middle School Teacher Connects with Students in Live Talk Show

div.a: Dalton Public Schools to Hold Virtual Out-of-Zone/Out-of-District Application Day

img.alt: Dalton Public Schools to Hold Virtual Out-of-Zone/Out-of-District Application Day

div.p: Dalton Public Schools will be accepting online applications for out-of-zone and out-of-district students for the 2020-21 school year. The online form will be available on the Dalton Public Schools website beginning on Thursday, April 16 at 8 a.m.

article.a: Read more about Dalton Public Schools to Hold Virtual Out-of-Zone/Out-of-District Application Day

div.a: Dalton High Student Qualifies for All-State Band

img.alt: Dalton High Student Qualifies for All-State Band

div.p: Brissa Fraire, flutist for the Dalton High School Band, recently qualified for the Georgia All-State band through the Georgia Music Educator's Association (GMEA).

article.a: Read more about Dalton High Student Qualifies for All-State Band

div.a: Board Approves Dalton High and Hammond Creek Principals

img.alt: Board Approves Dalton High and Hammond Creek Principals

div.p: The Dalton Board of Education approved Stephanie Hungerpiller as the principal of Dalton High School, effective July 1. Lauri Johnson, who currently serves as the principal of Dalton Middle School, was named the principal of Hammond Creek Middle School when it opens in August 2021.

article.a: Read more about Board Approves Dalton High and Hammond Creek Principals

div.a: Park Creek Teacher to Hatch Baby Chicks

img.alt: Park Creek Teacher to Hatch Baby Chicks

div.p: Chanel Dean, a STEM teacher at Park Creek, recently received a grant from the Whitfield County Farm Bureau to hatch baby chicks in her classroom.

article.a: Read more about Park Creek Teacher to Hatch Baby Chicks

div.a: ALL PROFILES

img.alt: Jesus Cortez at West Point graduation

figcaption.p: "There was always something to do around here. It's not like I'd end up going home and playing video games, I actually stopped playing video games in high school because there was so much to do. That shaped me into being versatile and always trying something new. I had a great experience with the school system."

img.alt: Monica Maldonado and her fiance in Washington DC

figcaption.p: "I'm really thankful I got to go through a robust IB and AP program because I exempted a lot of credit hours when I got to college, and I was well-prepared for the rigor of my college courses."

"My daughter has attended Brookwood since Pre-K and is about to start Dalton Middle School. Even though I'm 'not from around here,' I am proud to know that someday I will be the mother of a Dalton High School graduate. I love working for Dalton Public Schools and am proud to be part of the Dalton Difference."

"I had Carol Satterfield, she still teaches at Dalton Middle School. I saw her really take care of me and my older brother outside of the classroom, that's when I said, okay, this is what I want to do for the rest of my life."

"It's taken me a long, long time to get where I am. I've applied for this scholarship three years in a row, so it took consistency. I was considering not applying again just because I hadn't received it the past two years, but I'm so glad I did."

div.p: Dalton Public Schools has a graduation rate of 81.6%, a 3% increase from 2018.
Every student in 3rd through 12th grade receives their own device to integrate into their classroom experience.

The International Baccalaureate program is a rigorous pre-university program leading to assessments in six subject areas. It offers a challenging and demanding educational experience across the full curriculum.
72% of DPS staff members have advanced degrees.
Our students speak 42 different languages and come from 22 different countries.
Elementary students can participate in German and Spanish dual-language classrooms.
There are 7,900 students in Dalton Public Schools and more than 1,000 dedicated teachers and staff members.
The vision of Dalton Public Schools is: World-class learning that prepares students for success in college, career and civic life.

div.div: PO Box 1408 300 West Waugh Street Dalton, GA 30722
